block.p: Anne Eldridge Nolte, a daughter of Susan Finch Nolte and William D. Nolte Jr. of Darien, Conn., was married last evening to Thomas Alan Dippel, a son of Lucina Buckley Dippel and Dr. William A. Dippel of Wilmington, Del. The Rev. Joseph Cervero officiated at St. John Roman Catholic Church in Darien.

The bride, 26, is the manager of public relations for Chaiken, a New York women's clothing design company. She graduated from Fairfield University. Her mother teaches the fourth grade at Greenwich (Conn.) Catholic School. Her father has a management consulting practice in Darien and is a partner in the Exeter Group, a management consulting firm in New York.

Anne Eldridge Nolte, a daughter of Susan Finch Nolte and William D. Nolte Jr. of Darien, Conn., was married last evening to Thomas Alan Dippel, a son of Lucina Buckley Dippel and Dr. William A. Dippel of Wilmington, Del. The Rev. Joseph Cervero officiated at St. John Roman Catholic Church in Darien.

The bride, 26, is the manager of public relations for Chaiken, a New York women's clothing design company. She graduated from Fairfield University. Her mother teaches the fourth grade at Greenwich (Conn.) Catholic School. Her father has a management consulting practice in Darien and is a partner in the Exeter Group, a management consulting firm in New York.

The bridegroom, 29, is a partner in the Nassau Group, an investment banking firm, and a founding partner in the Estuary Group, an Internet business advisory and venture capital firm, both in Westport, Conn. He graduated from Princeton University. His father retired as a research manager for the DuPont Company, the chemicals manufacturer in Wilmington.
